skill.name: mixpanel-analytics
skill.description: MixPanel analytics tracking implementation and review Skill for Django4Lyfe optimo_analytics module. Implements new events following established patterns and reviews implementations for PII protection, schema design, and code quality.
skill.summary: MixPanel analytics tracking implementation and review Skill for Django4Lyfe optimo_analytics module....
skill.author: DiversioTeam

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill providing secure Mixpanel implementation patterns. Enforces PII protection and uses defensive coding. All 211 static findings are false positives triggered by documentation examples of legitimate development commands and normal software terminology.

content.value_statement: Tracking user behavior is essential for product insights, but implementing analytics incorrectly can expose sensitive user data. This skill guides you through secure Mixpanel implementation with built-in PII protection and code review processes.
actual_capabilities: Enforces PII protection with automated scanning
Reviews code for compliance and best practices
Generates defensive coding patterns with error handling
Validates schema design and event registration
Provides automated security checks and linting
limitations: Specific to Django4Lyfe optimo_analytics module structure
Requires existing Mixpanel account and configuration
Cannot audit runtime behavior of deployed code

use_cases.title: Implement New Analytics Events
use_cases.description: Safely add Mixpanel tracking to new features while ensuring PII protection and code quality standards.

use_cases.title: Review Analytics Implementations
use_cases.description: Audit existing analytics code for PII violations, security issues, and compliance with data governance policies.

use_cases.title: Standardize Analytics Patterns
use_cases.description: Establish consistent, secure analytics implementation patterns across your development team.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Event
prompt_templates.prompt: Use /mixpanel-analytics:implement to add tracking for when users complete their profile setup with organization context.

prompt_templates.title: Survey Analytics
prompt_templates.prompt: Run /mixpanel-analytics:implement svc.surveys.reminder_sent to add tracking for survey reminder notifications.

prompt_templates.title: Code Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use /mixpanel-analytics:review staged to check my MixPanel changes for PII violations and pattern compliance.

prompt_templates.title: Full Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the entire optimo_analytics module with /mixpanel-analytics:review all to identify security issues.

output_examples.input: Implement tracking for user login events
output: Generated secure schema with UUID strings only
Implemented tracking helper with keyword-only args
All validations passing - ready for integration

output_examples.input: Review staged changes for PII violations
output: PII Protection: PASS - No names, emails, or phone numbers found
Event Registration: PASS - All events properly registered
Schema Design: PASS - UUIDs correctly typed as strings
Service Patterns: PASS - Keyword-only args and try-except blocks present
Test Coverage: PASS - All test classes present
Generated schema with employee_id and organization_id as string UUIDs
Created pytest fixtures with Django DB marker
PII scan: PASS - No personal information fields

best_practices: Always use keyword-only arguments in tracking methods to prevent accidental parameter passing errors
Wrap all tracking calls in try-except blocks so analytics failures never break business logic
Use UUID strings (not UUID objects) for all identifiers to maintain consistency and type safety
anti_patterns: Never send personal information like names, emails, or phone numbers to analytics services
Do not let tracking failures propagate and break user-facing functionality
Avoid using cron in event names - use is_cron_job property instead for background jobs

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with my existing Django project?
faq.answer: The skill is designed for Django4Lyfe's optimo_analytics module but can be adapted for similar Django projects with Mixpanel.

faq.question: What are the limits on event tracking?
faq.answer: Mixpanel has generous free tier limits. The skill enforces best practices to prevent excessive tracking and maintain data quality.

faq.question: How does this integrate with my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: Use review mode in pre-commit hooks or CI to automatically check for PII violations and pattern compliance.

faq.question: How is my data kept safe?
faq.answer: The skill enforces strict PII protection, only allows organization_name as approved, and prevents sending personal user data.

faq.question: What if tracking fails in production?
faq.answer: All tracking is fire-and-forget with try-except. Failures are logged but never propagated to ensure your app works.

faq.question: How does this compare to other analytics skills?
faq.answer: This skill uniquely combines implementation guidance with security auditing for both functionality and privacy protection.
